Example: Split Configuration into Multiple Files

webpkr configurations can be split into multiple files. Simply require the parts like any other nodejs module.

code

webpack/index.js

[
  'base',
  'js',
  'fonts',
  'stats',
  'devtool',
  'dev_server'
].map( ( x ) => `./${x}` )
  .forEach( require )

base.js

context( projectDir )

entry( './src/index.js' )

output( () => {
  filename( 'bundle.js' )
  path$( 'dist' )
} )

stats( 'errors-only' )

cache( true )

resolve( { extensions: ['*', '.js', '.jsx'] } )

js.js

const path = require( 'path' )

module$( () => {
  rule( () => {
    test( /\.js$/ )
    use( 'babel-loader' )
    include( path.resolve( srcDirs.js ) )
    exclude( /node_modules/ )
  } )
} )

Configure Webpack

Create a webpack.config.js in your project’s root and add:

const webpkr = require('webpkr');
module.exports = webpkr({projectDir: __dirname});
